00058 
00059 #define S_MODIFIED    0x0001  // flag set if stage is modified
00060 #define S_WORKSPACE   0x0002  //                   is current workspace
00061 #define S_SYNCBASE    0x0004  //                   sync will only sync down to this stage
00062 #define S_SAVESTAGE   0x0008  //                   should get saved into file
00063 
00064 typedef struct s_stage_priv t_stage_priv;
00065 struct s_stage_priv
00066 {
00067         STRUCT_HEADER;
00068 };
00069 
00070 
00071 /*
00072     the stage represents one step in the decoding chain.
00073     the first stage is always the file that was opened.
00074     after that file was opened, each parser/decoder creates
00075     an extra stage each. so we are able to load a ZIP file
00076     containing a BZ2-compressed PHOENIX file and to patch it.
00077     the private data is handled by the format parser/decoder
00078     layer and also has to get free'd by calling the given
00079     routines with the stage they belong to.
00080 */
00081 typedef struct s_stage t_stage;
00082 struct s_stage
00083 {
00084         STRUCT_HEADER_LIST(t_stage);
00085     char *name;                 // like "UNPACKED"
00086     char *type;                 // type of content, set by child - maybe parser handles more than one type
00087     char *parser;               // name of the parser that created this one, like "PHOENIX"
00088     unsigned int length;        // length of data (accumulated)
00089     t_segment *segments;        // the segments
00090     t_symbols *symbols;         // symbols for that stage, variable pool
00091     t_stage_priv *priv;         // format parser private data
00092 };
00093 
00094 typedef struct s_stage_info t_stage_info;
00095 struct s_stage_info
00096 {
00097         STRUCT_HEADER_LIST(t_stage_info);
00098 };
00099
